'Are you doing something Maika?'%K%P
I started a conversation with Maika.%K%P
Since I'd been constantly attending to Akane\nlately, it was about time I checked in with\nMaika.%K%P
'Nothing special. Just chores.'%K%P
'Need any help?'%K%P
'I'm fine. You've been working with Akane and\nInori all this time. I think you should get some\nrest.'%K%P
'But you just came back from school too.'%K%P
'Don't worry about me. Look, it seems like\nthey're going out, so maybe you should join\nthem.'%K%P
'Hey, don't push me!'%K%P
I was kicked out of the living room like a stray\ncat and ended up just being lazy in my room.%K%P
'I can't just be in my room alone.'%K%P
It just didn't feel right for me to rest in my\nroom while Maika did all the chores.%K%P
But I knew that my childhood friend would never\nallow me to help her.%K%P
'Maybe I should make some tea for her.'%K%P
A harmless gesture.%K%P
'Hmm?'%K%P
I paused when I heard breathing... The kind of\nbreathing you'd make when asleep.%K%P
'*Zzz* Hmnum...'%K%P
'Maika?'%K%P
When I looked around, I found Maika sitting,\nleaning against a big garden tree in the corner\nof the courtyard.%K%P
'Is she asleep? I've never seen her take a nap\nlike this.'%K%P
'She's sound asleep.'%K%P
Since she's usually the one on top of things, it\nwas refreshing to see her looking child-like and\ninnocent like this.%K%P
It caught me off guard catching my long-time\nchildhood friend, who's just as cute as Akane\nand Inori, in such a vulnerable state.%K%P
'I should probably let her sleep.'%K%P
I leaned over to watch Maika's face as she\nslept.%K%P
'This is making me feel nostalgic.'%K%P
I looked around the courtyard while I was still\nleaned over.%K%P
'We used to play here a lot.'%K%P
When we were kids, this tiny courtyard felt a\nlot bigger.%K%P
I can recall many times when we would tire\nourselves out playing all day and end up passing\nout.%K%P
'Mmm...'%K%P
As I was remembering our days as kids, Maika\nslowly opened her eyes.%K%P
'Sorry, did I wake you?'%K%P
'Oh... Sho-chan...?'%K%P
'When was the last time you called me Sho-chan?'%K%P
As kids, we were Sho-chan and Mai-chan. But\nlater, we naturally grew out of it.%K%P
It was cute for us to do as kids.%K%P
'Th-That was a dream, right? But, if it\nwere...eheheh... Your hand...'%K%P
'Maika?'%K%P
Still half asleep, Maika tightly grasped my\nhand.%K%P
Our hands overlapped innocently, without any\nsense of distinction as man and woman.%K%P
This was exactly like when we played in the\ncourtyard as kids.%K%P
'Heheh... I like being like this.'%K%P
'Come to think of it, we used to hold hands a\nlot.'%K%P
'Yeah... Sho-chan, do you know that I love you?'%K%P
'Yeah, I love you too Maika.'%K%P
She's my dear childhood friend, after all.%K%P
'Heh... Oh? Huh?'%K%P
When Maika realized her fingers were entwined,\nher half-asleep vision started getting clearer.%K%P
'What? This...is real? Was that not just a\ndream?'%K%P
'Oh, well... Good morning Mai-chan.'%K%P
I unintentionally called Maika by her childhood\nname which made her turn bright red.%K%P
'Maika? Hey, Maika.'%K%P
'Oh, uhhh, d-did you see or hear anything?'%K%P
'Huh? Well, yeah.'%K%P
Since there was no point in lying, I answered\nhonestly.%K%P
'Heh, heheh, so you saw. You saw me asleep and\nsleep-talk...'%K%P
'Ahah, haha, ahahahahaha...'%K%P
'Whaaaaaat?!?! You gotta be kidding meeeee!'%K%P
'Why?! Why do you have to catch me at my most\nembarrassing moments?!'%K%P
'Whoa!'%K%P
Maika stood up with force while she raised her\nvoice.%K%P
'F-Forget it! Okay? Just forget everything you\nsaw just now. All of it. Okay?!'%K%P
'Sorry about all that, but you looked cute\nsleeping and it made me happy when you called me\nSho-chan.'%K%P
'Ack... please forget it... You meanie...'%K%P
Maika's voice shook and her face blushed with\nshame, all which resembled her as a timid child.%K%P
'I'm really sorry. I'm gonna leave since I'm\ndisturbing you.'%K%P
When I got up, Maika grabbed and pulled on my\nshirt.%K%P
It must've been unintentional because she looked\nsurprised herself.%K%P
'U-Um... I never said that you were disturbing\nme.'%K%P
'Are you sure?'%K%P
'Y-Yeah. B-By the way, do you remember? We used\nto play under this tree all the time.'%K%P
'Of course I do. We played together all the\ntime. We both carved on the tree to compare our\nheights.'%K%P
'Yeah, you're right. It was right over here.'%K%P
We went over to the other side of the tree and\nfound the rough lines we'd carved as kids.%K%P
We marked our heights with rocks we found and\ncompeted many times over our height.%K%P
'There they are. See, how nostalgic. You would\nalways say that you were taller than me no\nmatter what.'%K%P
'Ha, I didn't want a girl to beat me in height.'%K%P
'Eheh. But I was competitive with you too. Oh\nyeah, do you remember when you fell from this\ntree when you tried to climb it?'%K%P
'That hurt a lot. I didn't think the branches\nwould break so easily.'%K%P
When I slammed on the ground, I remember being\nsurprised about not breaking a bone.%K%P
'You cried quite a bit.'%K%P
'I know. And you started crying with me too. The\nwhole thing was a disaster.'%K%P
'Of course I cried. After a loud crack, you fell\nfrom above. Seeing you in so much pain, I\nthought you were going to die.'%K%P
Yup, not the smartest thing I'd done.%K%P
After that, we were scolded by Maika's parents\nand neighbors who rushed over when they heard\nour cries.%K%P
But I remember being more bitter about being\nbanned from playing in the courtyard than being\nscolded.%K%P
'Why did you want to climb the tree all of a\nsudden? You were never really the adventurous\ntype, even as a kid.'%K%P
'Uhh... Are you really making me answer that?'%K%P
'Yup. You saw me asleep and heard me sleep-talk\nearlier. We'll get even with this.'%K%P
'But, you told me to forget about it.'%K%P
'You saw it, right?'%K%P
'Fine.'%K%P
Oh well. It's embarrassing for both of us.%K%P
'I guess I was still young and reckless at the\ntime.'%K%P
'Yeah, so?'%K%P
'Well, so, I wanted to show off. I wanted to\nprove myself to you.'%K%P
'Pfff, haha. Seriously?'%K%P
'D-Don't laugh. I was serious at the time.'%K%P
Even as a kid, it was pretty stupid of me to\nshow off by climbing that tree.%K%P
'Heh, sorry, sorry. But, you climbed a tree to\nshow off.'%K%P
'I was really competitive as a kid. A-Anyway,\nthat's the reason I tried climbing it.'%K%P
'I see... So, what was the most memorable thing\nfor you, Sho?'%K%P
'Most memorable thing...?'%K%P
What could that be?%K%P
I struggled to go through my memories and\nremembered one thing.%K%P
'I know, it has nothing to do with the\ncourtyard, but I remember that horror TV show.'%K%P
'Horror TV show?'%K%P
'Oh? You don't remember?'%K%P
Even when I look back now, I still feel that it\nmade a huge impression on me.%K%P
'Hmm, sorry, can't remember. What about it?'%K%P
'We watched a horror show at night together and\nit was way too scary. You don't remember being\nscared?'%K%P
'There was a time when you would call me every\ntime you needed to go to the bathroom.'%K%P
'What...?'%K%P
'You would call me every other minute and kept\nthe door open just in case something happened so\nyou could escape.'%K%P
'Ahhh!'%K%P
Maika's faced turned bright red, much like\nearlier when I caught her asleep, and she sat\ndown, perplexed.%K%P
'A-Augh... Th-This is the worst. I had forgotten\nabout it and now it's all coming back to me...'%K%P
'I'm...sorry.'%K%P
I didn't realize it was going to be such a\nsensitive topic for her.%K%P
'You need to forget about it again! Including\nthe stuff from today! Don't ever remember them,\nor mention them again!'%K%P
'Y-Yeah. I'll forget it.'%K%P
'Promise? Ugh... What was wrong with me back\nthen?'%K%P
'It's like with me climbing the tree. We all do\nirrational things as kids.'%K%P
'Even then, it's still embarrassing... I'm\nexhausted. I'll be in the living room.'%K%P
'I'll go back with you. And as an apology, let\nme serve you some tea.'%K%P
'I'll accept it only if the tea's really good.'%K%P
'I'll do the best I can.'%K%P
While we were having tea in the living room, we\nheard hurried footsteps coming from the\nentrance.%K%P
'Sho, I'm back!'%K%P
'Welcome home, Akane.'%K%P
'Maika too, I'm back!'%K%P
'Yes. Welcome home, Akane.'%K%P
'Phew, it's been a while since I walked around\nthat much.'%K%P
'All right. I'll start preparing dinner now, so\njust wait a little longer.'%K%P
'Thanks. I'm starved!'%K%P
Akane sat down on a chair and lay herself on the\ntable, exhausted.%K%P
'Where were you today?'%K%P
'Oh, the shopping streets nearby, since I\nhaven't shown my face in a while.'%K%P
'Still as popular as ever I assume.'%K%P
'Yup. Everyone's so nice there.'%K%P
All thanks to Akane's sociable personality.%K%P
Her personality attracts so many people.%K%P
'Come to think of it, Inori's not back yet.\nAkane, do you have any idea where she went?'%K%P
'I don't know where she's been.'%K%P
'But I bumped into her on the way back, so we\nraced home.'%K%P
'Raced? You mean, you ran all the way home?'%K%P
'Yup, but I didn't run that much. Probably about\n100 meters.'%K%P
'100 meters...'%K%P
Even if that distance was a piece of cake for\nAkane, for someone like Inori who's not that\ngood at physical activities...%K%P
'*Huff* Augh... I-I'm back...'%K%P
I knew it.%K%P
'Are you okay, Inori?'%K%P
'Bwahaha, Inori, you really don't have any\nstamina.'%K%P
'Haa, haa, I-I'm done... I can't take another\nstep...'%K%P
'Are you okay? Here's some water.'%K%P
Maika returned from the kitchen and handed Inori\na glass of water.%K%P
'*Gulp gulp* Phew... I'm alive again. Thank you\nvery much, Maika.'%K%P
'Don't worry about it. I'm gonna go back to\nfinish making dinner.'%K%P
Maika stood up and headed to the kitchen. But,\nthen she turned back around.%K%P
'Hey, Sho.'%K%P
'Yeah?'%K%P
'It was nice when it was just us two here at\nTsubaki, but...it's actually kinda nice when\nit's lively like this too.'%K%P
'Ain't that the truth.'%K%P
Thus, another turbulent day had passed.%K%P
